result.markdown: --- engine: knitr knitr: opts_chunk: collapse: true editor: markdown: wrap: 72 --- :::: {.callout-important collapse='false' appearance='default' icon='false'} ## [Caution]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.25em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} This book is under development. Thank you for your patience. ::: :::: # Welcome! {.unnumbered} Welcome to my Unix/Linux Field Manual! This book aims to provide a quick reference for basic concepts and common tasks when using Unix/Linux operating systems.[^zsh-bash] :::: {.callout-tip collapse='true' appearance='simple' icon='false'} ## [What is in a Field Manual?]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.05em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 0.90em; color: #282b2d;'} A field manual (FM) is an educational tool that provides information, instructions, and techniques for various concepts and practices. Fiels Manuals function as both reference material and living documentation, encouraging updates and adaptations based on the given situation, available technology, or broader environment.[^field-manuals] ![Example improvised litter made using tent poles and field jackets.](img/jacket-pole-litter.png){width='70%' fig-align='center'} [^field-manuals]: This definition is based on the [U.S. Army Field Manuals (FMs).](https://github.com/mjfrigaard/fm-unix/tree/main/_assets/1965-fm531-boobytraps.pdf) ::: :::: [^zsh-bash]: Most of these commands will work on any Shell (Zsh, Bash, etc.) program. :::: {.callout-note collapse='false' appearance='simple' icon=false} ## [See a typo, error, or something missing?]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.15em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} Please open an issue on [GitHub.](https://github.com/mjfrigaard/fm-unix/issues/new) ::: ::::
